                     <h2 class="date-header">July 11, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002986"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2986">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Mad City Chickens!</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><em>I hear this is a must see... looks really fun and of great relevance to our community.</em>  </p>

<p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MCC-flier-SMALL.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MCC-flier-SMALL.shtml', 'popup', 'width=850,height=1100,scrollbars=yes,resizable=yes,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MCC-flier-SMALL-thumb.jpg" width="180" height="232" alt="MCC-flier-SMALL.jpg" align="left" hspace="5" vspace="5" /></a><strong>Saturday, July 25th at 4:30pm, Ojai Theater will be the local premiere of the film, "Mad City Chickens,"</strong> a wacky and wonderful documentary about one Wisconsin city's "chicken underground" fighting city hall to make their poultry passion legal.  This is a film you don't want to miss, even if you don't eat eggs or have a hankering for feathered friends.  You will laugh out loud and even Sci-Fi and Twilight Zone fans will appreciate the style of the film.  </p>

<p>One thing's for sure, if you've been on the fence about getting chickens, you'll be convinced to join the growing ranks of home farmers who are committed to a more sustainable food system and to make happy hens a part of your life.</p>

<p>After the film we'll be having a chat with Garm Beall, founder of the website <a href="http://backyardchickens.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">backyardchickens.com</a> about how to get started raising chickens with Q&A at the Village Jester pub next door.</p>

<p>This is a fundraiser ($10) for the Food & Agriculture Committee of the Ojai Valley Green Coalition, so that we can plant more vegetable gardens for folks and conduct more culinary events.  So please broadcast this to others (Ojai and beyond) who love food and need a good laugh!</p>

<p>Keep it fresh, keep it fun!<br />
Dulanie Ellis-La Barre<br />
Grow Food Party Crew & the Culinary Club</p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Tyler Suchman at 12:50 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/07/mad_city_chickens.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/07/mad_city_chickens.shtml#comments">Comments (0)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../tyler.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>
                           </div>

<p>The <a href="http://www.ojaipeace.org">Ojai Peace Coalition</a> is SO proud to have borne our 2008 Noble Peace Prize honorees, Tara Blasco and Lyn Hebenstreit, as dignitaries in last Saturday's Independence Day parade (along with former Marine Sergeant Lyn Weeks, representing Veterans for Peace)!  In addition to working to increase public health and decrease poverty in Africa, Lyn and Tara engage in spiritual activism right here in our valley community by leading meditation groups, as well as providing support for mothers and infants.  Learn about their work in Africa by visiting the <a href="http://globalresourcealliance.org/">Global Resource Alliance</a> website.</p>

<p>Nominations for the 2009 Noble Peace Prize are open now! <br />

                     <h2 class="date-header">June 27, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002957"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2957">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Deepak Chopra: A Tribute to My Friend, Michael Jackson</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><em>Some of you may remember when Deepak Chopra came to Ojai a few years ago. First he spoke to a SRO crowd at the Krotona Institute where he eloquently reminded us of the perennial wisdom, the oneness of all life, and not to identify too much with the various roles we play in this world. For one fleeting moment I almost felt enlightened. I "got it" when he said, "Life is not only stranger than you think, it is stranger than you CAN think."</p>

<p>After the Krotona event, Deepak gave a talk to an intimate gathering at the Ojai Retreat. I got lucky and was invited to dinner with him and his wife at the Ranch House. The next day he did a booksigning at Local Hero before being whisked away to a series of events in Los Angeles where he spoke before an audience of several thousand. </p>

<p>I'm sure Deepak has his flaws like all human beings, but I am impressed by his astute observations on the human condition. I just finished reading his compassionate tribute to Michael Jackson on the Huffington Post, and felt moved to post it here.</em></p>

<p><strong>A Tribute to My Friend, Michael Jackson</strong></p>

<p>"Michael Jackson will be remembered, most likely, as a shattered icon, a pop genius who wound up a mutant of fame. That's not who I will remember, however. His mixture of mystery, isolation, indulgence, overwhelming global fame, and personal loneliness was intimately known to me. For twenty years I observed every aspect, and as easy as it was to love Michael -- and to want to protect him -- his sudden death yesterday seemed almost fated.</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/06/deepak_chopra_a_tribute_to_my.shtml">Continue reading "Deepak Chopra: A Tribute to My Friend, Michael Jackson" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Suza Francina at 03:15 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/06/deepak_chopra_a_tribute_to_my.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/06/deepak_chopra_a_tribute_to_my.shtml#comments">Comments (0)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../suza.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>

<p>WHAT:                 The Ojai-Ventura International Film Festival celebrates two milestones this year: its 10th anniversary and joining forces with the City of Ventura to bring its selection of world class feature, short, animated and documentary films to an even broader audience. Known for its welcoming, familial spirit and dedication to showcasing compelling stories from budding and established filmmakers, the Festival is located just 70 miles from Hollywoodâs doorstep and has evolved into a top regional destination festival over the past ten years. Screened in locations throughout Ojai and Ventura, including the legendary Ojai Valley Inn & Spa, the Festivalâs past films include many that have subsequently received widespread distribution, honors and awards, including Academy Awards. Also, each year the Festival bestows Lifetime Achievement Awards on industry icons and a Limelight Award on the best film submitted by a student filmmaker. Past lifetime achievement honorees have included Ray Bradbury (Fahrenheit 451), Richard Donner (Lethal Weapon franchise, The Omen), Lauren Shuler Donner (St. Elmoâs Fire, Pretty in Pink, Dave) and Laszlo Kovacs (Ghostbusters).</p>

                        <h3 class="entry-header">New Iyengar Yoga Class Friday Mornings at 8 AM with Suza Francina at Sacred Space Studio in Ojai</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><strong>About the Instructor:</strong> <a href="http://suzafrancina.com/">Suza Francina</a>, is a <a href="http://www.iynaus.org/">Certified Iyengar Yoga Instuctor</a> who has taught since 1972. </p>

<p><strong>About the Class: </strong>All Level Iyengar Yoga Class <br />
Friday Mornings 8--9:25 AM, (New students please arrive early)<br />
Sacred Space Studio, 410 Bryant Circle, Suite A, Ojai. </p>

<p><strong>Class Description</strong><br />
Iyengar yoga classes cover the safe-practice of all categories poses: Restorative Poses, Standing Poses, Forward Bends, Back Bends, Twists, Inverted Poses, Lying Down Poses, Hip Openers, etc. Special attention is given to strengthening standing poses and deeply relaxing restorative yoga poses. Classes are unhurried, with plenty of props to provide support so that your practice is rejuvenating and restores your energy reserves. You will learn the safe practice of the two-pillars of yoga: Headstand and Shoulderstand. Those who are new to yoga will have the opportunity to practice safe, gentle variations, suitable for beginners. All ages and levels are welcome.</p>

                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2914">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">More Men of Ojai</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>The Council of Fabulousness will reconvene today to select  models for the 2010 Men of Ojai calendar.   Auditions will take place this afternoon from 2 to 4pm on the new patio of the Ojai Beverage Company, 655 E. Ojai Ave.   Those who are interested should bring a recent photo.  The calendar is being produced in partnership with Bret Bradigan, Attasalina Dews and myself.   Shooting will take place between June 22 and August 1.  The calendar will be unveiled Friday, October 16 at a gallery reception at the Ojai Valley Museum and will go on sale on Ojai Day, Saturday, October 17.   Proceeds from the calendar sales will benefit local arts programs.  For more information contact project manager Demitri Corbin at 805-603-0079 or email to demitri@pinkminute.com.</p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Demitri Corbin at 10:49 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/06/more_men_of_ojai.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/06/more_men_of_ojai.shtml#comments">Comments (21)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../demitri.shtml">author bio</a>

                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2896">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Hollywood Invades Ojai</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Currently writing from Ojai Coffee Roasting Co... there are literally twenty five Hollywood types in here sizing up OCRC as a location for some movie.   Of course they aren't grabbing a coffee, they are just creating a ridiculous amount of noise, pointing around where some actor is going to walk, and how the camera is going to catch the scene.   </p>

<p>Have I mentioned how much I don't miss living in LA?</p>

<p>From NPR's <a href="http://www.npr.org/blogs/allsongs/2009/05/the_beatbox_battle_world_champ.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">All Songs Considered</a>:</p>

<blockquote>Who's the greatest beatboxer in the world? We'll soon find out, when the annual Beatbox Battle World Championship gets underway in Berlin, Germany on May 28. Each year contestants from all over the world flock to the city to lay down some sweet, human-generated beats in hopes of snagging the grand prize. This year's winner will be crowned on May 31.
<br><br>
In the meantime, the BBWC has announced the winner of its wildcard competition. It's Julia Dales, a 17 year-old from Canada.</blockquote>

                        <div class="entry-content">

<p><em>CONCEPT REVIEW (CR 09-02) FOR THE REVAMPMENT OF A BOWLING CENTER THAT INCLUDES SITE IMPROVEMENTS, ADDITION OF APPROXIMATELY 475 SQUARE FEET TO THE EXISTING BUILDING, AND CONSTRUCTION OF THREE PATIO AREAS FOR OUTDOOR DINING AND A BATTING CAGE for property located at 1202 E. Ojai Avenue, Ojai, California, Assessorâs Parcel Number 028-0-073-010. The General Plan Land Use designation of the site is General Commercial (GC) and the Zoning classification of the site is General Commercial (C-1). Property Owner: Gail Bazzano. Applicant: Stacey Benotto.<br />
</em><br />
<strong>Wouldn't it be great to have the bowling center back after all these years? </strong></p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">April 14, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002761"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2761">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">The Place to Be for âTEAâ & Tennis</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/tea.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/tea.shtml', 'popup', 'width=448,height=297,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/tea-thumb.jpg" align="left" hspace="5" vspace="5" width="180" height="119" alt="tea.jpg"/></a><em>Submitted by Fran Pavelko, vice chairman:</em></p>

<p>HospitaliTEA is our SpecialTEA  - The Place to Be for âTEAâ & Tennis</p>

                        <h3 class="entry-header">âNoises Off!â at Ojai ACT</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><em>My friend, John Hankins, sent this over.  He is one of the actors in the play.  I'm taking advantage of the special this weekend and will attend Saturday night.  Hope to see you there!</em></p>

<p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/discount flyer/Noises%20Off%20Discount%20Flyer1%20%282%29.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/discount flyer/Noises%20Off%20Discount%20Flyer1%20%282%29.shtml', 'popup', 'width=366,height=480,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/discount flyer/Noises%20Off%20Discount%20Flyer1%20%282%29-thumb.JPG" align="left" hspace="5" vspace="5" width="180" height="236" alt="Noises Off Discount Flyer1 (2).JPG"/></a>Ojai ACT<br />
Art Center Theater<br />
A non-profit community ensemble</p>

<p>âNoises Off!â Opens</p>

<p>Leave it to an actor to write a play where the funniest action occurs backstage, but with equal hilarity onstage, coming to the Ojai Art Center Theater stage March 28 through April 25.</p>

<p>Itâs âNoises Off!â by Michael Frayn, who spawned this rowdy comedy while standing in the wings watching a farce starring Lynn Redgrave.</p>

<p>âIt was funnier from behind than in front and I thought that one day, I must write a farce from behind,â Frayn said.</p>

<p>âNoises Off!â is a play within a play, with the actors putting on a silly comedy entitled âNothing Onâ and blowing their lines, entrances and relationships.<br />
</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">March 17, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002716"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2716">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Poetry Gets Local</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2006/10/poetry_matters_in_ventura_and.shtml"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/shi.gif" width="72" height="72" hspace="5" vspace="5" alt="Poetry Matters! " style="float: right; border: 0px; padding-left: 10px; padding-right: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px;" border="0" /></a>Out of the <a href="http://ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/7.html">ashes of the official Ojai Poetry Festival</a>, a group of enthusiastic local volunteers has banded together to bring a new event to Ojai: <a href="http://ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/9.html">The Ojai Valley Poetry Fest</a> on June 6th, 2009 at the Ojai Art Center. The event will feature Wanda Coleman, Frank T. Rios, Jackson Wheeler, and Marsha de la O. </p>

<p>The group is also looking for local poets to host and perform half-hour to hour-long segments throughout the day of the festival, and volunteers in all aspects of the event. Admission is free in exchange for volunteering on the day of the event. To apply for the poetry program, send a short proposal--100 words or fewer--along with the number of poets involved to: <a href="mailto:OjaiPoets@gmail.com">OjaiPoets@gmail.com</a> by <strong>April 1, 2009</strong>.</p>

<p><a href="http://ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/9.html">Click here for more details about this exciting new event</a>.</p>

                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2703">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Stop The Trucks:  The First Casualty of War is the Truth</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/00%20no_truckaa.jpg" width="280" height="244" alt="00 no_truckaa.jpg"/></p>

<p>Hello Chris -</p>

<p>I've finally read your email regarding how the Coalition might obtain a full year's worth of weigh tickets from the Ozena Ranch Mine facility.  Obviously -  the "evidence" you've collected is entirely insufficient.</p>

<p>I've turned your email over to our attorney -- for I do not have the legal skills to know how to go from here.   Naturally - I view your email not only with great disappointment - but I also see it as one more example of how the Planning Division does not wish to let genuine evidence come to light by conveniently hiding behind a rather poorly collected and insufficient randsom sample of Ozena weight tickets.   I'm not that naieve, Chris, to believe that if you and your other colleagues really wished to collect a full year's data that you would certainly be able to do so.    The fact that you aren't willing to do that speaks volumes:  You fear the TRUTH and simply can't handle the TRUTH.</p>

<p>We'll have to seek another legal remedy to get to the bottom of this.  How  unfortunate.</p>

<p>Sincerely,</p>

<p>Michael Shapiro<br />
Chair - Stop The Trucks! Coalition<br />

                        <div class="entry-content">

                              <p>I was about to head down the hill to buy a cigar.  Itâs one of those forbidden pleasures I engage in a couple of times a year.  In order to curb my usage, I only buy one at a time.  That gives my guilt complex a chance to work on me before I actually lay out the cash.  Itâs an awful habit.  Mouth tastes like the inside of a shoe for two days.</p>

<p>So I said to Sweetie âYou know whatâ¦I think Iâll shlep down the hill to get a cigar.â  She said with a beautiful smile âGo ahead.  Youâll enjoy it.â    OK, I said, Iâll just check my e-mail.  Bad decision.</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">February 28, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002660"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2660">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Yogis Invited to Ventura's First Ever YOGATHON </h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>VENTURAâS FIRST EVER âYOGATHONâ TO SUPPORT KIDSâ ARTS</p>

<p>Today, Saturday, February 28, <a href="http://yogajones.com">Yoga Jones </a>and <a href="http://kidsartsventura.org">Kids' Arts </a>will host Ventura's first ever âYogathonâ fundraiser at the historical Elks Lodge, 11 S. Ash Street at Main, in Ventura.</p>

<p>Local teachers, including Ojai teachers Suza Francina at 2pm and Kira Ryder at 5pm, and others such as well-known Yogini and Indian dancer, Hemalayaa Behl, (4pm) will hold classes every hour from 9:00 am until 5:00 pm. The event will finish with an uplifting evening Kirtan, with the Ojai Kirtan Band at 7:00 pm.</p>

<p>A full day pass is $50 at the door or $15 per class, which includes free entry to the evening Ojai Kirtan Band event.</p>

<p>Arrive early to register and bring a mat and blanket. <br />
 <br />
Besides the yoga classes, the Yogathon features a silent auction, art exhibit, refreshments, massage and healing arts. </p>

<p>The event coordinators hope to raise awareness and funds to support continued free art and yoga classes for disadvantaged youth. One demonstration during the event will include a group of children asked to draw a picture and then participate in yoga, afterwards they will be asked to draw another image to illustrate the immediate difference yoga makes in a childâs perspective.<br />
</p>

<blockquote>The Ojai Post is a community blog, featuring Ojai residents from all walks of life writing about the unique Ojai experience. Ojai is a special place, not just for its geography, flora and fauna, small-town architecture and rich native American history - its also because of the people - talented, creative souls who tend to walk to the beat of their own drummer and carve their own path through life. Check in for daily musings, rants, Ojai news and greater goings-on from the place some call Shangri-La.</blockquote>

See press release or poster for ticket locations. This year's theme is "Venetian Vibrations: Unmask Your Passion!" Fittingly, artist Robert Lamarche's amazing masks are on sale now at Studio Sauvageau for those who need a stunning, last minute costume.</p>

<p>Live music, costume contest, Rondia's Southern homestyle cooking plus beer, wine, cocktails, fantastic decorations and slideshow! Don't miss the coronation of 2009 Mardi Gras King and Queen Scott and Betsy Smith of Euterpe Farms!</p>

<p>As always, this is a fundraiser and I have a special interest this year because my stepson, Denlow Enlow (my late wife Harmony's son), is the beneficiary of the proceeds. He is coping with the devastating effects and expenses of ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis), also known as Lou Gehrig's Disease.</p>

<p>Please help us get the word out to the community about this year's 19th annual benefit.<br />
Thanks,<br />
Lanny Kaufer</p>

                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Right here in our own backyard, we have two great wineries with tasting rooms open to the public: Casa Barranca and Old Creek Ranch (have you been?).  <a href="http://www.organic-wine.com/">Casa Barranca</a> specializes in organic wine, and <a href="http://www.oldcreekranch.com/">Old Creek</a> has some wonderful Mediterranean styles.  We also have <a href="http://www.movinowinebar.com/">Movino</a>, where Buddy Wilds serves up glasses of intriguing varieties, like Earthquake Zin or Caymus Conundrum, when heâs not up on the stage or coiffing a hair-do or two.  And over at the <a href="http://www.ojaibevco.com/">Ojai Beverage Co.</a>, Jorge and Joby have daily tastings to tempt any palate, and 1000 bottles to choose from.  Iâll be presenting on local wines <a href="http://vcreporter.com/cms/story/detail/ventura_county_s_grape_escape/6027/">(there are more than you'd think)</a> at the upcoming <a href="http://www.womensexpovc.net/">Ventura County Womenâs Expo</a> and would love to hear your thoughts about wine.  What have you tasted lately thatâs got you swooning over the grape?  And do you have any fun wine quotes (or even song lyrics) to share, like, âIn vino veritas (In wine there is truth),â or Dean Martinâs, âYou haven't drunk too much wine if you can still lie on the floor without holding on.â</p>

<p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/mt/mt-search.cgi?IncludeBlogs=1&search=Dishing+Ojai%3A">More <em>Dishing Ojai </em>columns here.</a></p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">February 09, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002624"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2624">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Golda Meir Comes to Ojai!  </h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/Golda%2Cjpg.jpeg" width="200" height="240" alt="Golda,jpg.jpeg"/></p>

<p>Golda Meir, (1898-1978) will be portrayed by noted Ojai actor, Catherine Dain, in a 45 minute staged abridged reading of William Gibson's play:</p>

<p>                                                                    <u><strong>GOLDA'S BALCONY</strong></u></p>

<p>                                                Directed by Gai Jones and produced by Edie Smith<br />
                                                            7 PM    Saturday   Feb 28, 2009 </p>

<p>                                                             Jewish Community of the Oaks<br />
                                                            530 West El Roblar, Meiners Oaks<br />
                                                             Suggested minimum Donation $10 <br />
                                                    Program will be followed by a Dessert Reception    </p>

<p>"Goldaâs Balcony" offers the compelling story of Golda Meirâs transformation from a young Russian immigrant in Milwaukee to an activist for a Jewish state in Palestine and then to its leader â Prime Minister of Israel. </p>

<p>Framing her tale with the decisions she was forced to make during the 1973 war, she attempts to answer the question âWhat is the price for survival?â There were no easy answers for Golda, who sacrificed her relationships with her husband and children for her obligations to her country. Her uneasy conclusion was,  </p>

<p>       âPeace, there will be peace when the Arabs learn to love their children more than they hate the Jews". </p>

<p></p>

<p>                       <em>"Perfect!"</em>  New York Magazine                                 <em>"Enlightening!"</em> New York Times     <br />
 <br />
		               <em>"Amazing Personal History!"</em>  Variety   </p>

<p>                                  <em>"Laughter and Tears!"</em> Akron Beacon Journal       <em>"Fascinating !"</em> AP     </p>

<p>                                                    <em>  "Momentous ! Riveting!" </em>The Detroit News       <br />

                        <h3 class="entry-header">A mystery portrait of Obama as a young man?</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Great story from the <a href="http://www.latimes.com/news/local/la-me-portrait4-2009feb04,0,7314913,full.story" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">LA Times</a>... maybe you recognize the painting from the Ojai for Obama campaign headquarters?</p>

<blockquote><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/44863381.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/44863381.shtml', 'popup', 'width=300,height=280,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/44863381-thumb.jpg" width="60" height="56" alt="44863381.jpg" hspace="5" vspace="5" align="left" /></a>

<p>Lindberg "was going through the stacks and said, "Hey, did you know this is Barack Obama?' " [Ojai's David] Bush said.</p>

<p>"It's truly one of those yard-sale finds," said Bush, an environmental lawyer.</p>

<p>The painter gave the portrait to Lindberg, who tried to donate it directly to Obama's national campaign, Bush said. But she never got a response to her queries. When Lindberg learned that Ojai was mounting its own campaign push, she stepped forward with the donation. As soon as McCluer saw it, she had to have it, her husband said. McCluer offered $2,000, but the campaign office organizers were unsure whether they should part with it. </blockquote><br />
</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">January 13, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002538"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2538">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Rebuilding Libbey Bowl</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><i>from the Ojai Music Festival...</i></p>

<p><strong><a href="http://www.LibbeyBowl.org" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Libbey Bowl</a></strong> serves as a historic gathering place for events including the Ojai Music Festival.  Over the last few years, the City of Ojai has conducted numerous structural studies only to find that the termite and wood rot damage is so severe that the Libbey Bowl is in critical condition and must undergo a major rebuild.</p>

<p>Please join the City of Ojai, Ojai Music Festival, and the Ojai community at the Commissions Special Joint Meeting to hear about plans for rebuilding the Bowl.</p>

<p><strong>THURSDAY, JANUARY 15, 2009</strong><br />
7:00 pm<br />
Sarzotti Park (510 Park Road, Ojai)<br />
open to the general public</p>

<p>Agenda items include:<br />
    * Overview of Assessment and Needs<br />
    * David Bury of Bury Architects unveiling of preliminary site plans</p>

<p>If you would like to volunteer or donate to the Libbey Bowl project, please contact<br />
(805) 646-3117 or email info@LibbeyBowl.org.<br />
</p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Tyler Suchman at 03:01 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/rebuilding-libbey-bowl.shtml">Permalink</a>

                        <div class="entry-content">

                              <p><i>The 9th annual Ojai Martin Luther King Jr. Day Community Celebration is coming on Monday, January 19.  Press release follows...</i></p>

<p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MLK_09Poster_small.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MLK_09Poster_small.shtml', 'popup', 'width=480,height=604,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/MLK_09Poster_small-thumb.jpg" width="160" height="201" hspace="5" vspace="5" align="left" alt="MLK_09Poster_small.jpg"/></a>The Ojai Valley Youth Foundation is pleased to announce that John R. Hatcher III, President of the Ventura County Chapter of N.A.A.C.P., will be the featured speaker at this yearâs Martin Luther King, Jr. Day Celebration. The 9th annual event, free to the public, will be held in Ojaiâs downtown Libbey Park on Monday, January 19, from 11 AM to 4 PM.</p>

<p>Special guest performers include San Diego hip hop musician/poet Gill S.O.T.U. and gospel choir Living Sacrifice from Santa Barbara. Top local youth musicians and singers will represent many of the schools in the area. They will be joined by Ojai-based, internationally known singers Perla Batalla and Julie Christensen. Local youth will provide food, booths, artwork and much more. Many Ojai students are participating in a writing contest based on this yearâs theme.</p>

                     <a id="a002536"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2536">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Music Listening Thread</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/punch.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/punch.shtml', 'popup', 'width=800,height=800,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/punch-thumb.jpg" width="160" height="160" alt="punch brothers chris thile" hspace="5" vspace="5" align="left"  /></a>I'm really enjoying Punch Brothers, which is led by Chris Thile, formerly of Nickel Creek.  The album is sort of bluegrass chamber music.  It's a fascinating listen.  I'm also enjoying the last Nickel Creek album "Why Should The Fire Die?," which I never got around to buying when it came out in 2005.  I picked up both albums this weekend on iTunes.</p>

<p>I've also been playing with the Pandora app on my iPhone.  You pick an artist you like, and it starts streaming songs you can give a thumbs up or thumbs down to, and as it learns your preferences, it builds out essentially a radio station.  I have a few channels set up, including ones based on Old Crow Medicine Show, Moby and Mother Hips.  It's very similar to SonicNet's app, which was available in the late '90's, but was killed due to licensing restrictions.</p>

<p>What are you listening to?<br />
</p>

                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Tyler Suchman at 12:53 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/music_listening_thread.shtml">Permalink</a>

                     <h2 class="date-header">January 08, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002526"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2526">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Musician Al Westcott Passes On</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><i>I received the following email from Howard Freiberg regarding the passing of local musician Al Westcott...</i></p>

<p><b>Goodbye Old Friend</b><br />
<img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/304.jpg"  hspace="5" vspace="5" align="left" height="200" alt="Al Westcott Ojai"/>He was a friend of mine.  He was a friend of many.  It is with deep sadness that I inform you of the passing of Al Westcott last night, January 7, 2009.  Al has been a very close friend of mine since 1983.  Many of you met him at past Ojai Rock Fest shows.  He performed as "Maggie's Pa" as well as helping put on the production of many of these events.  Al died while doing what he loved best....playing music.  He was performing at a Retirement Home when he passed out and later died of a massive heart attack.  Al was the person who got me to come to Ojai almost 6 years ago by helping me land a great job.  He was the one who went with me to the doctor when I was first diagnosed with Cancer, and then went on to organize a benefit to help me pay the mound of expenses I was to incur.  He was a true friend.  Everyone who met Al always liked him.  He made people smile.  He had a great sense of humor, and was extremely charitable, even down to his dying minute.  It was a pleasure knowing you Al, you'll be greatly missed!<br />
 <br />
<a href="http://www.alwestcott.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Al's Web Site</a><br />
<a href="http://www.myspace.com/59573749" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Al's MySpace Page</a><br />
<a href="http://radioojai.com/2007/12/21/al-westcott-when-the-kingdom-comes.aspx" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Feature on RadioOjai.com</a></p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Tyler Suchman at 10:24 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/al-westcott-ojai.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/al-westcott-ojai.shtml#comments">Comments (16)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../tyler.shtml">author bio</a>

                     <h2 class="date-header">January 07, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002525"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2525">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Good Music. Good Fun. Joe Reilly.</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>If you love to have a good time and you enjoy music, then the <em>Ojai Valley Women's Club</em> in downtown Ojai is the place to be this Saturday evening at 6:00pm. <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/leslie.shtml">Leslie</a> and I met <a href="http://www.joereilly.org">Joe Reilly</a> a couple years ago and were immediately impressed by his honest music and deep connection with environmental issues, spirituality, and to children. Joe was a huge hit for those who attended his show at the Eco Store. Don't miss this chance to see our friend from Michigan (he has a song or two about that too!) open his West Coast Tour in Ojai. </p>

<p><object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/fcI5OHEN924&hl=en&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/fcI5OHEN924&hl=en&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed></object></p>

<p>The show starts at 6:00pm on Saturday, January 10, 2009. The suggested donation is $10/adults, $5/children, $25/family, and age 5 and under are free. Tickets will be available at the door. We're happy to have Deina Bleu Santoyo opening the show with a set of her favorite lullabies made popular by Disney and Dreamworks. You can to hear <a href="http://www.myspace.com/joereillymusic">more songs by Joe</a> on MySpace.<br />
<blockquote><br />
Joe Reilly is a born teacher and naturalist. He creates music that is especially accessible to children and addresses issues and joys of our environment. - Great Lakes Bioneers</blockquote></p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Kenley Neufeld at 09:08 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/good_music_good_fun_joe_reilly.shtml">Permalink</a>

                     <h2 class="date-header">January 05, 2009</h2>
                     <a id="a002523"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2523">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Valley Poetry Association General Meeting</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2006/10/poetry_matters_in_ventura_and.shtml"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/shi.gif" width="72" height="72" hspace="5" vspace="5" alt="Poetry Matters! " style="float: right; border: 0px; padding-left: 10px; padding-right: 10px; padding-bottom: 10px;" border="0" /></a>Not long after the <a href="http://www.ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/7.html">disappointing news</a> that the <a href="http://www.ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/7.html">2009 Ojai Poetry Festival has been cancelled</a>, a group of poets and poetry lovers in Ojai, many of them past volunteers and committee members from previous festival seasons, began organizing with the intent to bring poetry to Ojai in a new and different form. I am pleased to pass on this announcement of <a href="http://www.ojaipoetryfestival.org/news/8.html">the first general meeting of the Ojai Valley Poetry Association</a>:</p>

<blockquote>Hello Poets and Festivilians,

<p>We were all shocked and dismayed (although not entirely surprised, considering the current economic climate) to hear that the festival committee had to cancel the intended program for the 2009 Ojai Poetry Festival.</p>

<p>Nevertheless, a few of us optimistic souls met at the library and vowed to continue the good work of Festival co-founders Jim Lenfestey, Linda Silver, and Gael Belden--albeit in a new incarnation. To that end, John Kertis formed the Ojai Valley Poetry Association (OVPA), an unincorporated, non-profit entity under the auspices of the Ojai Valley Library Friends & Foundation, to oversee potential fundraising and organization of this year's festival. The current five-member board consists of myself, John Kertis, Liz Grumette, Dave Ray and Phil Taggart.</p>

<p>We're sending out a call to old and new friends of poetry to meet on Wednesday, January 21 at 7 p.m. at the Ojai Library to discuss the new agenda, new line-up possibilities and fund-raising potential. Volunteers are needed to design and manage all aspects of the Festival. All are welcome to the conversation.</p>

<p>Please pass the word.</p>

<p>Your Poetry Pal,<br />
Tree Bernstein</blockquote></p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Robert Peake at 09:11 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/ojai_valley_poetry_association.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2009/01/ojai_valley_poetry_association.shtml#comments">Comments (6)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../robert.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>
                           </div>

                     <h2 class="date-header">December 17, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002481"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2481">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Stop the Trucks: Ozena Loses Court Case on Trucking Hours</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/go-away.JPG" width="424" height="447" alt="go-away.JPG"/></p>

<p>In a case titled "Elizabeth Ann Vergilio Vs. County of Ventura," the owners of the Ozena gravel mine challenged the County's right to impose hours of operation and transit through the Ojai Valley.</p>

<p>Judge Reiser ruled against Virgilio and Ozena.  Even though Stop the Trucks was not a direct participant in this case, it is a huge victory for the Coalition.  Much of the County's brief was based on our research and complaints.</p>

<p><u>The "Stop the Trucks" Coalition has not only been supporting the County's contention that the rules must hold, we've also insisted that the County also actually enforce those rules.</u></p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/12/stop_the_trucks_ozena_loses_co.shtml">Continue reading "Stop the Trucks: Ozena Loses Court Case on Trucking Hours" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 08:09 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/12/stop_the_trucks_ozena_loses_co.shtml">Permalink</a>

                     <h2 class="date-header">December 15, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002473"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2473">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Latest from the OV Museum</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><i>an update on the Sing Me a Story, Dance Me Home exhibit and other news from the Ojai Valley Museum...</i></p>

<p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ann%20scanlin-teachers-web.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ann%20scanlin-teachers-web.shtml', 'popup', 'width=629,height=474,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ann%20scanlin-teachers-web-thumb.jpg" width="150" height="113" alt="ann scanlin-teachers-web.jpg" hspace="5" vspace="5" align="right" /></a>Ann Scanlin, President of the Ojai Valley Museum Board of Trustees, met with valley teachers and museum docents to discuss the latest exhibit at the museum. She gave them interpretive materials that they can use to prepare their students for this exhibit and the enrichment programs that the museum will provide to enlighten students about the culture of Native California. The exhibit is a beautiful collection of art, sculpture, basketry, and poetry created by Native Californians. âI believe this will be a wonderful experience for my students and the community,â noted Ron Schindel, sixth grade teacher at Oak Grove School.<br />

                     <h2 class="date-header">December 07, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002458"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2458">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Happy Chalica!</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Today is the last day of <b>Chalica</b>, a seven-day celebration of the principles that underlie the <a href="http://uua.org/">Unitarian Universalist</a> movement, beginning on the first Monday in December.  Like all holy-days, it was conceived by a person to meet a need; in this case is was a woman named Daylene Marshall from British Columbia, who a few years ago decided that a winter holiday to honor the UU principles would be a community-building and unifying thing.  Chalica continues to grow grassroots-style, with people discovering and creating it every year.  The general practice is to light a chalice (or candle) in one's home each day in honor of one principle, and to give gifts or take actions that further it.  Part of its beauty for me is that, just as one needn't be a Christian to celebrate Christmas, you don't have to identify as a Unitarian Universalist to appreciate and celebrate these ideals!  The seven principles are:<br />
<blockquote><b>1. The inherent worth and dignity of every person;<br />
2. Justice, equity and compassion in human relations;<br />
3. Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations;<br />
4. A free and responsible search for truth and meaning;<br />
5. The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large;<br />
6. The goal of world community with peace, liberty and justice for all;<br />
7. Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.</b></blockquote></p>

<p>**<em>Read on for an exclusive Radio Ojai interview and hilarious video!</em>**</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/12/happy_chalica.shtml">Continue reading "Happy Chalica!" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by evan austin at 08:03 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/12/happy_chalica.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/12/happy_chalica.shtml#comments">Comments (5)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../evan.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>

                        <h3 class="entry-header">Hiking, Chatting and Eating in Ojai</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ovlc%201%202008.shtml" onclick="window.open('http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ovlc%201%202008.shtml', 'popup', 'width=640,height=480,scrollbars=no,resizable=no,toolbar=no,directories=no,location=no,menubar=no,status=no,left=0,top=0' ); return false"><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/ovlc%201%202008-thumb" width="180" height="135" align="left" hspace="5" vspace="5" alt="ovlc 1 2008"/></a>A couple of weeks ago, I went on a hike with Ojai Valley Land Conservancy preserve manager, Rick Bisaccia, and 20 other trekkers.  He took us up to the 80-acre Ilvento Preserve, the first property the OVLC acquired in 1997.  I last went on this 2-mile hike with the OVLC <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2006/06/ojai_valley_land_conservancy_c.shtml">in the spring of 2006</a> to write a story for the Sierra Clubâs local paper, and although the wildflower sightings were abundant, so, too, were the ticks.  This time, the dry weather kept the ticks away, but Rick took the time to give his now famous Tick Talk, which served to give us all the willies.  About a mile into the hike are some of the most spectacular views in the valley.  I snapped this photo of Rick with my cell phone at the preserveâs highest point, 2024 feet, offering views of Lake Casitas and, on clear days, the Pacific.  The Ilvento Preserve is open year-round to the public. For more information on the OVLC, to become a member (itâs cheap!) or to find out about their guided hikes, <a href="http://ovlc.org/">check-out their Web site</a> for dates, times and reservation information.</p>

<p>More after the jump, including evan on Radio Ojai, and cheap eats in the valley...</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">November 25, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002432"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2432">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Sing Me Your Story, Dance Me Home</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/tatoo%20woman%20returns_lyn%20risling.web.jpg" height="240" alt="tatoo woman returns_lyn risling.web.jpg" hspace="5" vspace="5" align="right" /><i>(press release from the Ojai Valley Museum...)</i>  For the second time in the past few years the Ojai Valley Museum is hosting an exhibition produced by the California Resources Alliance (CERA). The first one, Votes of the Women, aroused a large interest in the Ojai community in 2001. The second, Sing Me Your Story, Dance Me Home: Art and Poetry from Native California will also be a âmust-seeâ because of the museumâs access to these engaging, high quality exhibits.</p>

<p>All over the world people have handed down their stories, be they English ballads, Irish whaling tunes, native and Inuit and African-American tribal stories and tunes. All stories have played and important role in our collective oral history. Native California and Chumash traditions, arts, and crafts have done this in the same way for California. Like the state itself, the California Native peoples are remarkably diverse with over 300 languages and distinct geographical centers that shape communities, traditions, ideologies and ceremonies. The works exhibited in Sing Me Your Story, Dance Me Home are embedded with California forests, rivers, deserts, valleys and mountains. Native California surrounds us everywhere we look.</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/11/sing_me_your_story_dance_me_ho.shtml">Continue reading "Sing Me Your Story, Dance Me Home" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Tyler Suchman at 09:39 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/11/sing_me_your_story_dance_me_ho.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/11/sing_me_your_story_dance_me_ho.shtml#comments">Comments (13)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../tyler.shtml">author bio</a>

<p>The singer/songwriter sued McCain in August after the Republican candidate for the highest office in the land used his song, âRunning on Empty,â in a campaign commercial that targeted Obamaâs energy plan. At the time, many didnât take the legal threat very seriously, but based on two motions filed this week in U.S. District Court in California, the McCain campaign sure does. </p>

<p>The second filing is...an anti-SLAPP motion, which is typically used by defendants as a way to seek monetary damages after a plaintiff has subjected a defendant to a lawsuit meant to chill free speech. So far, McCain is only looking for attorneyâs fees and costs, but claiming an artist has interfered with free speech is quite the poke of an eye in show business. </p>

<p><strong>Jimi Hendrix's drummer Mitch Mitchell dies</strong><br />

<p>Mitch Mitchell, the British drummer in the seminal 1960s band the Jimi Hendrix Experience, has been found dead in his US hotel room, authorities say.                      <h2 class="date-header">November 10, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002403"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2403">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Film Festival Wrap Up</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>âI thought the first line was vulgar and rude. It made me not want to read any further and not attend the film festival.<br />
Comment #10 Posted by: another anonymousâ*</p>

<p>This afternoon as I crossed the street to go into the post office I noticed that the Ojai Theatre marquee still announced the Ojai Film Festival.  It's Monday, another work week and our attention moves on to upcoming events.  But this year's film festival marks the beginning of a new direction for the festival. <br />
OFF treasurer Bill Monot in opening statements before Saturday night's gala event noted that the festival happened during this worsening financial climate.  I don't know what the numbers are as far as attendance.  There were many screenings that were not very well attended.  And others were full, like the gala event at the Ojai Valley Inn on Saturday night.    </p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/11/ojai_film_festival_wrap_up.shtml">Continue reading "Ojai Film Festival Wrap Up" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>

                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>I had the chance to see Miriam Makeba on Paul Simon's Graceland tour and had already been a fan of so many of her recordings. She passed away yesterday at age 76.                         <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Film Festival 2008</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Photo Slide Show Coming Soon!</p>

<p>âWill someone please shove something up my #$@ AND MAKE ME FEEL LIKE I'M ALIVE AGAIN!!!"</p>

<p>That quote is from a disgruntled guest attending last year's<a href="http://ojaifilmfestival.com"> OFF</a> film makers party.  I laughed remembering the situation which prompted the remark as I bicycled to the Ojai Valley Inn  to pick up my press credential.  This year, festival organizers hope to erase the memory of last year's debacle with a strategy to bring the festival's profile up a notch.  Leading the way is OFF chairman<a href="http://www.dshor.com"> David Shor</a>.  With sponsorship   from Ojai Valley Inn & Spa and the first Annual Ojai film Festival Celebrity Golf Classic, along with an expanded program, organizers have a long range vision of attracting a wider regional audience.  I ran into David at OFF's makeshift office at the inn's Shangri la Pavilion.  He was in a mad dash of finish last minute details before the opening night party that included a silent and live auction, golf tournament award ceremony, and the traditional free outdoor movie screening.  </p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">October 31, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002369"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2369">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Radio Ojai: Sergio Aragones</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>The <a href="http://ojaifilmfestival.com/">Ojai Film Festival </a>asked me to be their official podcaster this year, which led me to an amazing interview with <a href="http://www.sergioaragones.com/">Sergio Aragones</a>, the world's fastest cartoonist and creator of the 2008 Ojai Film Festival poster and program cover.  Sergio talked with me about his life as a cartoonist, his 40 years with MAD Magazine, his love of film and what brought him to Ojai 25 years ago.  At 71 years old, with a handle bar mustache, long gray pony tail and deep Spanish accent, I found him to be engaging and utterly charming.  If I sound a bit giddy, it's because I'm smitten!  <a href="http://radioojai.com/2008/10/31/ojai-film-festival-sergio-aragones.aspx">Listen here </a>(9 minutes, 30 seconds).</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">October 25, 2008</h2>

                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2350">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Stop the Trucks: City Council Candidate, Betsy Clapp, Answers Our Election Year Questions</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/Western%20Materials%201a.jpg" width="480" height="400" alt="Western Materials 1a.jpg"/><br />
<em>(photo credit to Ray Smith, Daly Road Graphics)</em></p>

<p><strong>1) Do you now or have you in the past personally supported "Stop the Trucks!"</p>

<p><em>Yes, I have and I will continue to do so.</em></p>

<p>2) If so, please give examples of actions you have actually taken.</p>

<p><em>I have donated money.  I am also actively speaking out about your organization "Stop the Trucks" and letting people know that I will do everything I can to support the cause when I am elected.</em></p>

<p>3) Do you believe the Ojai City Council should take a more active role in the truck campaign, such as providing funding and legal support?</p>

<p><em>The City Council has agreed to give financial support to the "Stop the Trucks" organization.  There are some legal hurdles that need to be addressed, but I believe we need to find a way to make it happen.</em> </strong></p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">October 23, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002345"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2345">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Stop the Trucks: County Planning Officials Failed to Heed Warnings About Potential Road Collapse </h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><strong>Danger Apparently Still Being Ignored by Planning Division </strong></p>

<p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/DSC00002%5B1%5D.JPG" width="448" height="336" alt="DSC00002[1].JPG"/></p>

<p><em>(All pictures are courtesy of Maureen and Dan Smith, Wheeler Hot Springs)</em></p>

<p>In a August 21, 2006 letter regarding the Ozena Valley Ranch Mining project, the Board of the Ojai Valley Municipal Advisory Council warned Christopher Stephens, then the Director of Planning for the Ventura County Planning Division and now the head of the entire Resource Managment Agency for the County,  that <em>"SR-33 has suffered many landslides and slipped roadways in past years.  The vibration created by the mine's trucks on SR-33 may be adding significantly to the problem of road slippage, slumps, and slides. No review of vibration as a potential impact on SR-33 has been included in the Draft MND and vibration from trucks may present a significant adverse impact on the environment."</em></p>

<p>In February of 2008 a portion of Route 33 collapsed into the river.  Below are a dozen photographs of the damage done, indicating the collapse was far more significant than originally reported.<br />
</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_county_plannin_1.shtml">Continue reading "Stop the Trucks: County Planning Officials Failed to Heed Warnings About Potential Road Collapse " &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 04:31 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_county_plannin_1.shtml">Permalink</a>

                     <h2 class="date-header">October 21, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002342"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2342">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Kaufers Create Music Video in Support of Obama </h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p>Local musician and activist Lanny Kaufer and his son Aran recently created an inspiring new music video in support of Barack Obama. Lanny originally recorded his âTime to Believeâ Martin Luther King, Jr-inspired song in 2004, when he created his album, "The High Road," with an all-star band and notable background vocals by the late, great June Pointer of the Pointer Sisters. </p>

<p><br />
<object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/QmXmnOwMCp4&hl=en&fs=1"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/QmXmnOwMCp4&hl=en&fs=1" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed></object></p>

<p><br />
Then, this year, with original producer Cody LePow at the helm, they brought in Ojai's own James Antunez to replace Lanny's lead vocal with his soul jazz stylings. Aran Kaufer just recently created a video for it and put it up on YouTube in support of Barack Obama's campaign. Echoing the song's refrain, Lanny says that, "Now's the time to believe in the good we can do."</p>

<p>The Kaufer family's first YouTube video, "You Rock, Barack," accessible from this <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QmXmnOwMCp4">YouTube</a> link under the heading "more from: kaufer2008," has been viewed by over 25,000 people since December. A third Obama video, "Rise," a solo project by Aran, can also be found there.</p>

<p><br />
</p>

<p>"Stop the Trucks" has turned its attention from Diamond Rock to the Ozena Valley Ranch and Gravel mine.</p>

<p><em>At Tuesday nightâs City Council meeting the council agreed to give financial support to the Stop the Trucks Coalition, after a victory for the citizensâ group in August...</p>

<p>âAfter this agreement has been worked out, keeping the Diamond Rock Mineâs trucks out of Ojai, it has been pretty clear to me that whatever this group did, they did it successfully,â said Mayor Sue Horgan.</em></p>

<p>If you love a good Pac 10 rivalry and a cold frosty beer as part of your Saturday activities, then make a point of being at Ojai Day on October 18 in downtown Ojai.<br />
Ojaiâs premier cultural event and street fair has taken another step forward this year by providing a beer and wine garden in the Los Caporales parking lot next to Libbey Park. And a big screen TV will be set up in the beer garden for the football game between the Stanford Cardinal and UCLA Bruins beginning at 2 p.m. Note able Nordhoff High School Alum Micah Reed is the center for the Bruins. </p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">October 12, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002305"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2305">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">STOP THE TRUCKS:  Ojai City Council to Meet Tuesday on how to Deal with Ozena</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/AA%20001%20%20images.jpg" width="300" height="200" alt="AA 001  images.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>This Tuesday, October 14th, at 7:30 pm the Ojai City Council will meet for its regular session.  Part of the agenda will be devoted to discussions on how to co-ordinate efforts to deal with the Ozena Valley Ranch & Gravel Mine's proposed renewal and modification of their C.U.P. with the County of Ventura.</p>

<p>Given the well documented negative impact of these highly disruptive and polluting mining and trucking operations on agriculture, fishing,  the economy, our water supply, our environment and the health of our children, the "Stop the Trucks" Coalition urges everyone in the Ojai Valley to attend and share your opinions with the City Council.</strong></p>

<p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/Exhaust.jpg" width="300" height="333" alt="Exhaust.jpg"/></p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 09:52 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_ojai_city_coun.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                  <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../howard.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                                          

                     
                     <a id="a002304"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2304">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">STOP THE TRUCKS:  Ozena Wants to Expand Hours of Trucking Thru Ojai and Hand Pick the Consultant who will Review their new Proposal!</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/012208%20Ojai%20Montgormery%20Aajpg.jpg" width="475" height="280" alt="012208 Ojai Montgormery Aajpg.jpg"/></p>

<p><em>(Trucks passes through town on Ojai Ave & Montgomery, photo credit to Ray Smith, Daly Road Graphics)</em></p>

<p><br />
<strong>In documents recently obtained by the Ojai "Stop the Trucks"  through a Ventura County Public Records Request, the Coalition has learned that Ozena wants to alter their existing permit so that trucking through the Ojai Valley will begin as early as 3:00 am and continue as late as 6:00 pm during the week with "No Route Restrictions" at all on Saturdays!</p>

<p>This proposal would more than double trucking from a total of seven hours a day during the week to a new and even more intrusive and disturbing 15 hours a day!</strong></p>

<p>In a recent review of weigh tickets from 2007, the  "Stop the Trucks" Coalition estimated that Ozena is likely now violating existing permit hours in trips through Ojai by as much as 55%.  In a letter to "Stop the Trucks," County CEO, Ms. Marty Robinson, agreed with the Coalition that violations have been under reported by the Planning Division.</p>

<p>In a further review of emails obtained through that same Records Request, we found that the agent for Ozena, John Hecht of West Coast Environmental & Engineering, rejected the consultant the County originally selected, URS, because: <em> "...the proposed costs did not appear in line to the anticipated scope of work.  Ozena believes that a competitive process will provide a qualified CEQA contractor in a more cost effective manner."</em></p>

<p>In a separate email Mr. Hecht then went on to propose the names of three other firms:</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_ozena_wants_to.shtml">Continue reading "STOP THE TRUCKS:  Ozena Wants to Expand Hours of Trucking Thru Ojai and Hand Pick the Consultant who will Review their new Proposal!" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 09:22 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_ozena_wants_to.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                  <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../howard.shtml">author bio</a>
                              </p>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                     </div>
                                          

                     
                     <a id="a002303"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2303">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">STOP THE TRUCKS: County CEO Finds Ozena Violations Greater Than Reported</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/0033%20Stop%20A.jpg" width="400" height="175" alt="0033 Stop A.jpg"/></p>

<p>In a letter to  the Ojai "Stop the Trucks" Coalition, Ventura County CEO, Ms. Marty Robinson, wrote: <em>"After the CEO's office reviewed the July and August 2007 weigh tickets tickets communicated by the RMA" (Resource Management Agency) "a statistically significant sampling of the 649 original tickets was conducted by our office and it was determined that potential  northbound violations were omitted from consideration by the Planning Division.  If these potential northbound violations had been included , the number of violations would have been materially higher..."</em></p>

<p>"Stop the Trucks" had previously reported that upwards of 55% of all Ozena related trips through the Ojai Valley were likely in violation of these rules.</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_county_ceo_fin.shtml">Continue reading "STOP THE TRUCKS: County CEO Finds Ozena Violations Greater Than Reported" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 08:18 AM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/10/stop_the_trucks_county_ceo_fin.shtml">Permalink</a>

                        <h3 class="entry-header">Ojai Celebrates Art</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><i>from the Ojai Valley Museum...</i></p>

<p>First juried art exhibit at the Ojai Valley Museum, October 18 â November 16. This special exhibit showcases art by seventy artists working in a wide variety of media (painting, photography, printmaking, book art, sculpture, ceramics and mixed media), each inspired by an Ojai Valley theme. Reception and award ceremony will be on Ojai Day, October 18th from 3-5 p.m. Admission to the museum will be free that day. 130 W. Ojai Avenue, Ojai. (805) 640-1390 for more information.</p>

                     <h2 class="date-header">September 06, 2008</h2>
                     <a id="a002200"></a>
                     <div class="entry" id="entry-2200">
                        <h3 class="entry-header">Stop the Trucks: Ventura County Officials Finally Admit there are Problems and MAC Candidate Jerry Kaplan Responds to our Election Year Questions</h3>
                        <div class="entry-content">
                           <div class="entry-body">
                              <p><img src="http://www.ojaipost.com/images/33beforeHD%20.jpg" width="400" height="300" alt="33beforeHD .jpg"/><br />
<em>(Caltrans photo of the collapse of Maricopa Highway in Cuyama Valley)</em></p>

<p>Last week in a Ventura County Star article by Tony Biasotti, Ventura County officials conceded that there are significant problems in the Planning Division but the real questions is this:  Are they Willing To Change?</p>

<p>http://www.venturacountystar.com/news/2008/sep/04/officials-concede-land-use-problems/</p>

<p>According to Biasotti Ventura County officials hosted an unusual meeting in a conference room just off of the courthouse cafeteria.</p>

<p>"Everyone on our team has affirmed we have a problem here," Matt Carroll, the top deputy to County Executive Officer Marty Robinson, said at the opening of the meeting. "The facts speak for themselves."</p>

<p>"Complaints about the system from developers and property owners are nothing new..."  " But this time, the county is listening and often agreeing..."</p>

<p>"Last year, the county commissioned a report on its land-use procedures by Tom Berg, a consultant who once held (Chris) Stephens' current position as Resource Management Agency director. Based on interviews with 75 people in and out of county government, Berg's report concluded that the land-use process was in need of "systemic changes."</p>

<p>"The county put together a committee of high-level managers, including Carroll and Stephens, to analyze Berg's recommendations and start putting them into action."</p>
                                                            <p class="entry-more-link">
                                 <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/09/stop_the_trucks_ventura_county.shtml">Continue reading "Stop the Trucks: Ventura County Officials Finally Admit there are Problems and MAC Candidate Jerry Kaplan Responds to our Election Year Questions" &raquo;</a>
                              </p>
                              
                              <p class="entry-footer">
                                 <span class="post-footers">Posted by Howard Smith at 02:33 PM</span> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/09/stop_the_trucks_ventura_county.shtml">Permalink</a>
                                 | <a href="http://www.ojaipost.com/2008/09/stop_the_trucks_ventura_county.shtml#comments">Comments (1)</a> <span class="separator">|</span> <a class="permalink" href="../howard.shtml">author bio</a>

<p><em>(Downtown Ojai in Winter, photo credit to Lauren Simone)</em></p>
